title: IT firm Zensar's profits slide 11.5% YoY, revenue up 5.4%
description: Zensar Technologies reported a mixed bag of results for the second quarter. While revenue increased, profits declined due to a slump in the TMT vertical and US region. Despite this, the company's order book and margins improved.
content: Mid-tier technology services firm Zensar Technologies reported a decline in net profit by 11.5% year-on-year (YoY) and 1.3% quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) at Rs 155.7 crore for the second quarter ending September of fiscal year 2025 (Q2FY25). The profit was impacted by a dent in the Telecommunication, Media and Technology (TMT) vertical and US region due to non-seasonal furloughs.The Pune-based company’s revenue increased 5.4% YoY to Rs 1,308 crore in Q2FY25, which was up 1.6% on a sequential basis.In dollar terms, the company’s revenue rose 4% YoY and 3.3% in constant currency terms to $156.2 million in Q2FY25.“We delivered a rounded positive performance in Q2FY25, with sequential growth in majority of our portfolio. Our highest ever order book this quarter reflects the continued focus on client-centricity and commitment of our employees to drive value and innovations,” said Manish Tandon, CEO and managing director at Zensar Technologies.
